messages.content: Thank you for calling Nestlé customer service. My name is Davinci. May I know your name, please?
Hi Davinci, my name is Brian. I'm having some concerns about Kitkat. Can you help me?
Of course, Brian. I’m here to help. What seems to be the problem with Kitkat?
Well, I ate a Kitkat bar yesterday and now I'm feeling really sick. Could it be something in the product that caused this?
I'm sorry to hear that you're feeling unwell, Brian. Can you tell me more about the symptoms you are experiencing?
I've been having stomach pain and nausea since last night. I just don't understand what could have caused this.
That sounds concerning, Brian. Have you checked the expiration date on the Kitkat bar? Also, were there any other foods you ate around the same time?
Yes, I checked the expiration date, and it was fine. I didn't eat anything unusual, just my regular meals.

Thank you for the information. It’s possible that you might be experiencing an allergic reaction or a sensitivity to an ingredient in the Kitkat. Have you had any issues with chocolate or other candies before?
Not that I can recall. This is the first time something like this has happened.

I understand. To be safe, I recommend you consult with a healthcare professional regarding your symptoms. In the meantime, I can report this issue to our quality assurance team. Could you please provide the batch number from the packaging?
Sure, the batch number is 12345678. I really hope this is just a one-time thing.
Thank you, Brian. We take these matters seriously and will investigate further. If there’s anything else I can assist you with, please let me know.
That's all for now. Thanks, Davinci. I’ll talk to a doctor about this.
You're welcome, Brian. I hope you feel better soon. Have a good day.
